00021 #include <votca/ctp/fragment.h>

00023 using namespace std;
00024 namespace votca { namespace ctp {
00025 
00026 Fragment::Fragment(Fragment *stencil)
00027          : _id(stencil->getId()), _name(stencil->getName()+"_ghost"),
00028            _top(NULL), _mol(NULL), _rotateQM2MD(stencil->getRotQM2MD()),
00029            _CoQM(stencil->getCoQM()), _CoMD(stencil->getCoMD()),
00030            _trihedron(stencil->getTrihedron()) {
00031 
00032     vector< Atom* > ::iterator ait;
00033     for (ait = stencil->Atoms().begin();
00034          ait < stencil->Atoms().end();
00035          ait++) {
00036 
00037         Atom *newAtom = new Atom(*ait);  
00038         this->AddAtom(newAtom);
00039     }
00040 }
00041 
00042 
00043 
00044 Fragment::~Fragment() {
00045     vector < Atom* > ::iterator atmit;
00046     for (atmit = this->Atoms().begin();
00047           atmit < this->Atoms().end();
00048           ++atmit) {
00049           delete *atmit;
00050     }
00051     _weights.clear();
00052     _atoms.clear();
00053 
00054     vector < PolarSite* > ::iterator pit;
00055     for (pit = this->PolarSites().begin();
00056             pit < this->PolarSites().end();
00057             ++pit) {
00058         delete *pit;
00059     }
00060     _polarSites.clear();
00061 }
00062 
00063 
00064 void Fragment::AddAtom(Atom* atom) {
00065     _atoms.push_back( atom );
00066     atom->setFragment(this);
00067     _weights.push_back( atom->getWeight() );
00068 }
00069 
00070 void Fragment::AddPolarSite(PolarSite *pole) {
00071     _polarSites.push_back(pole);
00072     pole->setFragment(this);
00073 }
00074 
00075 
00076 void Fragment::Rotate(matrix spin, vec refPos) {
00077     vector <Atom*> ::iterator ait;
00078     for (ait = _atoms.begin(); ait < _atoms.end(); ait++) {
00079         vec dir = (*ait)->getQMPos() - refPos;
00080         dir = spin * dir;
00081         vec pos = refPos + dir;
00082         (*ait)->setQMPos(pos);        
00083     }
00084 }
00085 
00086 void Fragment::TranslateBy(const vec &shift) {
00087 
00088     _CoMD = _CoMD + shift;
00089 
00090     vector <Atom*> ::iterator ait;
00091     for (ait = _atoms.begin(); ait < _atoms.end(); ait++) {
00092         (*ait)->TranslateBy(shift);
00093     }
00094 }
00095 
00096 
00097 void Fragment::RotTransQM2MD() {
00098     vector <Atom*> ::iterator ait;
00099     for (ait= _atoms.begin(); ait < _atoms.end(); ait++) {
00100         vec newQMPos = _rotateQM2MD*( (*ait)->getQMPos() - this->_CoQM )
00101                       + this->_CoMD;
00102         (*ait)->setQMPos(newQMPos);
00103     }
00104 }
00105 
00106 void Fragment::calcPos(string tag) {
00107     vec pos = vec(0,0,0);
00108     double totWeight = 0.0;
00109 
00110     for (int i = 0; i< _atoms.size(); i++) {
00111         if (tag == "MD") {
00112             pos += _atoms[i]->getPos() * _atoms[i]->getWeight();
00113         }
00114         else if (tag == "QM") {
00115             pos += _atoms[i]->getQMPos() * _atoms[i]->getWeight();
00116         }
00117         totWeight += _atoms[i]->getWeight();
00118     }
00119 
00120     if (tag == "MD") {
00121         _CoMD = pos / totWeight;
00122     }
00123     else if (tag == "QM") {
00124         _CoQM = pos / totWeight;
00125     }
00126 
00127 
00128 }
00129

00131 
00132 void Fragment::Rigidify(bool Auto) {
00133 
00134     // +++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++ //
00135     // Establish reference atoms for local frame //
00136     // +++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++ //
00137     
00138     vector<Atom*> trihedron;
00139     
00140     if (Auto) {
00141 
00142         // Automated search for suitable atoms
00143         bool enough = false;
00144         vector< Atom* > ::iterator ait = this->Atoms().begin();
00145 
00146         while (!enough) {
00147 
00148             if (ait == this->Atoms().end()) { break; }
00149             Atom *atm = *ait;
00150             ait++;
00151 
00152             // When specifying mapping weights for rigid fragments,
00153             // mobile atoms (whose position can vary significantly with
00154             // respect to the rigid plane, for instance) should have a weight 0.
00155             // We do not want to pick those to establish the local frame.
00156             if (atm->getWeight() == 0.0) { continue; }
00157             else {
00158                 trihedron.push_back(atm);
00159                 if (trihedron.size() == 3) { enough = true; }
00160             }
00161         }
00162     }
00163     else {
00164 
00165         // Take atoms specified in mapping file <= DEFAULT
00166         vector<Atom*> ::iterator ait;
00167         for (ait = _atoms.begin(); ait < _atoms.end(); ait++) {
00168             if ( ! (*ait)->HasQMPart() ) { continue; }
00169 
00170             if ( (*ait)->getQMId() == _trihedron[0] ||
00171                  (*ait)->getQMId() == _trihedron[1] ||
00172                  (*ait)->getQMId() == _trihedron[2] ) {
00173                 Atom *atm = *ait;
00174                 trihedron.push_back(atm);
00175             }
00176         }
00177     }
00178 
00179     int _symmetry = trihedron.size();
00180 
00181     // +++++++++++++++++++++++ //
00182     // Construct trihedra axes //
00183     // +++++++++++++++++++++++ //
00184 
00185     vec xMD, yMD, zMD;
00186     vec xQM, yQM, zQM;
00187 
00188     if (_symmetry == 3) {
00189 
00190         vec r1MD = trihedron[0]->getPos();
00191         vec r2MD = trihedron[1]->getPos();
00192         vec r3MD = trihedron[2]->getPos();
00193         vec r1QM = trihedron[0]->getQMPos();
00194         vec r2QM = trihedron[1]->getQMPos();
00195         vec r3QM = trihedron[2]->getQMPos();
00196 
00197         xMD = r2MD - r1MD;
00198         yMD = r3MD - r1MD;
00199         xQM = r2QM - r1QM;
00200         yQM = r3QM - r1QM;
00201 
00202         zMD = xMD ^ yMD;
00203         zQM = xQM ^ yQM;
00204 
00205         yMD = zMD ^ xMD;
00206         yQM = zQM ^ xQM;
00207 
00208         xMD = xMD.normalize();
00209         yMD = yMD.normalize();
00210         zMD = zMD.normalize();
00211         xQM = xQM.normalize();
00212         yQM = yQM.normalize();
00213         zQM = zQM.normalize();
00214 
00215     }
00216 
00217     else if (_symmetry = 2) {
00218 
00219         vec r1MD = trihedron[0]->getPos();
00220         vec r2MD = trihedron[1]->getPos();
00221         vec r1QM = trihedron[0]->getQMPos();
00222         vec r2QM = trihedron[1]->getQMPos();
00223 
00224         xMD = r2MD - r1MD;
00225         xQM = r2QM - r1QM;
00226 
00227         // Normalising not necessary, but recommendable, when doing...
00228         xMD = xMD.normalize();
00229         xQM = xQM.normalize();
00230 
00231         vec yMDtmp = vec(0,0,0);
00232         vec yQMtmp = vec(0,0,0);
00233 
00234         // ... this: Check whether one of the components is equal or close to
00235         // zero. If so, this easily gives a second leg for the trihedron.
00236         if      ( xMD.getX()*xMD.getX() < 1e-6 ) { yMDtmp = vec(1,0,0); }
00237         else if ( xMD.getY()*xMD.getY() < 1e-6 ) { yMDtmp = vec(0,1,0); }
00238         else if ( xMD.getZ()*xMD.getZ() < 1e-6 ) { yMDtmp = vec(0,0,1); }
00239         if      ( xQM.getX()*xQM.getX() < 1e-6 ) { yQMtmp = vec(1,0,0); }
00240         else if ( xQM.getY()*xQM.getY() < 1e-6 ) { yQMtmp = vec(0,1,0); }
00241         else if ( xQM.getZ()*xQM.getZ() < 1e-6 ) { yQMtmp = vec(0,0,1); }
00242 
00243         if ( abs(yMDtmp) < 0.5 ) {
00244            // All components of xMD are unequal to zero => division is safe.
00245            // Choose vector from plane with xMD * inPlaneVec = 0:
00246            double tmp_x = 1.;
00247            double tmp_y = 1.;
00248            double tmp_z = 1/xMD.getZ() * (-xMD.getX()*tmp_x - xMD.getY()*tmp_y);
00249            yMDtmp = vec(tmp_x, tmp_y, tmp_z);
00250            yMDtmp.normalize();
00251         }
00252         if ( abs(yQMtmp) < 0.5 ) {
00253            double tmp_x = 1.;
00254            double tmp_y = 1.;
00255            double tmp_z = 1/xQM.getZ() * (-xQM.getX()*tmp_x - xQM.getY()*tmp_y);
00256            yQMtmp = vec(tmp_x, tmp_y, tmp_z);
00257            yQMtmp.normalize();
00258         }
00259 
00260         // Now proceed as for symmetry 3
00261         zMD = xMD ^ yMDtmp;
00262         yMD = zMD ^ xMD;
00263         zQM = xQM ^ yQMtmp;
00264         yQM = zQM ^ xQM;
00265 
00266         xMD.normalize();
00267         yMD.normalize();
00268         zMD.normalize();
00269         xQM.normalize();
00270         yQM.normalize();
00271         zQM.normalize();
00272 
00273     }
00274 
00275     else if (_symmetry = 1) {
00276 
00277         xMD = vec(1,0,0);
00278         yMD = vec(0,1,0);
00279         zMD = vec(0,0,1);
00280         xQM = vec(1,0,0);
00281         yQM = vec(0,1,0);
00282         zQM = vec(0,0,1);
00283 
00284     }
00285 
00286     else {
00287         cout << endl
00288              << "NOTE: Invalid definition of local frame in fragment "
00289              << this->getName();
00290         cout << ". Assuming point particle for mapping. "
00291              << endl;
00292 
00293         xMD = vec(1,0,0);
00294         yMD = vec(0,1,0);
00295         zMD = vec(0,0,1);
00296         xQM = vec(1,0,0);
00297         yQM = vec(0,1,0);
00298         zQM = vec(0,0,1);
00299         
00300     }
00301     
00302     // +++++++++++++++++ //
00303     // Rotation matrices //
00304     // +++++++++++++++++ //
00305     
00306     matrix rotMD = matrix(xMD, yMD, zMD);
00307     matrix rotQM = matrix(xQM, yQM, zQM);
00308 
00309     matrix rotateQM2MD = rotMD * rotQM.Transpose();
00310     _rotateQM2MD = rotateQM2MD;
00311 
00312 
00313     // ++++++++++++++++++ //
00314     // Transform fragment //
00315     // ++++++++++++++++++ //
00316 
00317     this->calcPos("QM");
00318     this->RotTransQM2MD();
00319     _translateQM2MD = _CoMD - _CoQM;
00320 
00321 }
00322
